name: Colombo
highlights: Gangaramaya Temple; Pettah Market; Galle Face Green; Old Dutch Hospital
description: Sri Lanka’s commercial capital—good for food, museums and colonial history.

name: Negombo
highlights: Negombo Beach; Fish Market; Dutch Canal
description: Closest beach town to the international airport; handy for first/last night.

name: Kandy
highlights: Temple of the Tooth; Kandy Lake; Royal Botanical Gardens (Peradeniya)
description: Historic hill country city and gateway to the scenic highlands.

name: Sigiriya
highlights: Sigiriya Rock Fortress; Pidurangala sunrise hike
description: Iconic rock citadel in Sri Lanka’s Cultural Triangle, with sweeping views.

name: Dambulla
highlights: Dambulla Cave Temples
description: UNESCO-listed cave temple complex known for vivid murals and Buddhas.

name: Polonnaruwa
highlights: Ancient city ruins; Gal Vihara stone Buddhas; cycling between sites
description: Expansive ancient capital best explored by bicycle.

name: Anuradhapura
highlights: Sri Maha Bodhi; Ruwanwelisaya; Abhayagiri Monastery
description: Sacred ancient city with monumental stupas and a living Buddhist heritage.

name: Habarana
highlights: Access to Minneriya/Kaudulla safaris; central base for Sigiriya/Polonnaruwa
description: Convenient base for safaris and exploring the Cultural Triangle.

name: Nuwara Eliya
highlights: Tea estates; Gregory Lake; base for Horton Plains
description: Cool-climate town amid tea estates; ‘Little England’ vibes.

name: Ella
highlights: Nine Arch Bridge; Little Adam’s Peak; Ella Rock; scenic train
description: Popular hill town with hikes, viewpoints and the island’s most scenic train rides.

name: Haputale
highlights: Lipton’s Seat; tea factory visits
description: Laid-back tea country with sweeping views and fewer crowds than Ella.

name: Adam’s Peak (Sri Pada)
highlights: Night hike; sunrise at the summit; pilgrimage season
description: Famous pilgrimage mountain; best climbed overnight in season for sunrise.

name: Horton Plains National Park
highlights: World’s End trek; Baker’s Falls
description: Highland plateau with iconic World’s End cliff walk and waterfalls.

name: Galle (Fort)
highlights: Galle Fort ramparts; lighthouse; boutiques; cafes
description: UNESCO-listed Dutch fort town with cafes and sunset-walk ramparts.

name: Unawatuna
highlights: Unawatuna Beach; Jungle Beach; Japanese Peace Pagoda
description: Close to Galle with a lively beach scene and easy snorkeling.

name: Mirissa
highlights: Coconut Tree Hill; Whale watching (Dec–Apr); Secret Beach
description: South coast favorite for beaches and seasonal whale-watching.

name: Weligama
highlights: Beginner surf beach; stilt fishermen nearby
description: Beginner-friendly surf bay, great for first lessons.

name: Hiriketiya (Dikwella)
highlights: Hiriketiya Bay; cafes; boutique stays
description: Horseshoe bay with consistent waves and stylish cafes.

name: Tangalle
highlights: Long beaches; rock pools; Rekawa turtle beach (seasonal)
description: Quieter stretch of coast with long beaches and fewer crowds.

name: Yala National Park (Tissamaharama)
highlights: Leopards; elephants; varied landscapes
description: Sri Lanka’s most famous safari park, known for leopard sightings.

name: Udawalawe National Park
highlights: Large herds of elephants; Udawalawe Reservoir
description: Reliable elephant sightings; a popular alternative to Yala.

name: Arugam Bay
highlights: Main Point & Peanut Farm surf; laid-back vibe
description: Laid-back east coast surf town, best in the May–Sep season.

name: Trincomalee / Nilaveli
highlights: Nilaveli Beach; Pigeon Island snorkeling; Koneswaram Temple
description: Calm east-coast waters ideal for snorkeling in season.

name: Passikudah / Kalkudah
highlights: Shallow bay swimming; long sandy arc
description: Shallow, sheltered bay with glassy water in season.

name: Jaffna
highlights: Nallur Kovil; Delft Island; Jaffna Fort
description: Distinct Tamil culture, food and island day trips in the far north.

name: Knuckles Mountain Range
highlights: Day hikes; waterfalls; cloud forests
description: UNESCO-listed biosphere with rugged trails and villages.

name: Kalpitiya
highlights: Kitesurfing lagoon; dolphin watching (Nov–Mar)
description: Windy peninsula famous for lagoon kiting and seasonal dolphin trips.

name: Bentota
highlights: Wide beach; river safaris; watersports
description: Classic resort town with long beaches and water activities.

name: Hikkaduwa
highlights: Coral reef snorkeling; beach strip
description: Busy beach town with easy-access snorkeling in season.
